column1: Table D2.14.6: Cultural identification, by jurisdiction, Indigenous Australians aged 18 and over, 2018–19(a)

column2: Identifies with a clan, tribal or language group(b)

column7: Allowed to visit homelands/ traditional country
column10:
Does not recognise homelands/
traditional country

column1: † Estimate has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution.
‡ Estimate has a relative standard error greater than 50% and are considered unreliable for general use.
(a) Includes only those present at the interview.
(b) Categories include: a tribal group, a language group, a clan, a mission, Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander/Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander group.
(d) Includes 'don't know whether allowed to visit homelands/traditional country'.

Note: Cells in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data and discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals. Excludes not stated responses.
Source: AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Survey 2018–19.
